an3.126:1.1: At one time the Buddha was wandering in the land of the Kosalans when he arrived at Kapilavatthu.
an3.126:1.2: Mahānāma the Sakyan heard that he had arrived.
an3.126:1.3: He went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. The Buddha said to him,
an3.126:2.1: “Go into Kapilavatthu, Mahānāma, and check if there’s a suitable guest house where I can spend the night.”
an3.126:2.2: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He returned to Kapilavatthu and searched all over the city, but he couldn’t see a suitable guest house for the Buddha to spend the night.
an3.126:3.1: Then Mahānāma went up to the Buddha, and said to him,
an3.126:3.2: “Sir, there’s no suitable guest house in Kapilavatthu for you to spend the night.
an3.126:3.3: But there is this Bharaṇḍu the Kālāma, who used to be the Buddha’s spiritual companion.
an3.126:3.4: Why don’t you spend the night at his hermitage?”
an3.126:3.5: “Go, Mahānāma, and set out a mat.”
an3.126:3.6: “Yes, sir,” replied Mahānāma. He went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage, where he set out a mat, and got foot-washing water ready. Then he went back to the Buddha and said to him,
an3.126:3.7: “The mat and foot-washing water are set out.
an3.126:3.8: Please, sir, go at your convenience.”
an3.126:4.1: Then the Buddha went to Bharaṇḍu’s hermitage, sat down on the seat spread out,
an3.126:4.4: “It’s too late to pay homage to the Buddha today.
an3.126:4.6: Tomorrow I’ll pay homage to the Buddha.” He bowed to the Buddha and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, then he left.
an3.126:5.1: Then, when the night had passed, Mahānāma the Sakyan went up to the Buddha, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him:
an3.126:5.2: “Mahānāma, there are these three teachers found in the world.
an3.126:5.4: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures,
an3.126:5.5: but not of sights or feelings.
an3.126:5.6: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures and sights,
an3.126:5.8: One teacher advocates the complete understanding of sensual pleasures, sights, and feelings.
an3.126:5.9: These are the three teachers found in the world.
an3.126:5.10: Do these three teachers have the same goal or different goals?”
an3.126:6.1: When he said this, Bharaṇḍu said to Mahānāma,
an3.126:6.5: For a second time, Bharaṇḍu said,
an3.126:6.9: For a third time, Bharaṇḍu said,
an3.126:7.2: “The Buddha has rebuked me three times in front of this illustrious Mahānāma.
